gobblin.runtime

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.runtime.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaskIFace, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskIFaceWrapper

    public class Task
extends Object
implements TaskIFace
    A physical unit of execution for a Gobblin WorkUnit.

    Each task is executed by a single thread in a thread pool managed by the TaskExecutor and each Fork of the task is executed in a separate thread pool also managed by the TaskExecutor. Each Task consists of the following steps:

    • Extracting, converting, and forking the source schema.
    • Extracting, converting, doing row-level quality checking, and forking each data record.
    • Putting each forked record into the record queue managed by each Fork.
    • Committing output data of each Fork once all Forks finish.
    • Cleaning up and exiting.
    Each Fork consists of the following steps:
    • Getting the next record off the record queue.
    • Converting the record and doing row-level quality checking if applicable.
    • Writing the record out if it passes the quality checking.
    • Cleaning up and exiting once all the records have been processed.

      • Task

        public Task(TaskContext context,
            TaskStateTracker taskStateTracker,
            TaskExecutor taskExecutor,
            Optional<CountDownLatch> countDownLatch)
        Instantiate a new Task.
        Parameters:
        context - a TaskContext containing all necessary information to construct and run a Task
        taskStateTracker - a TaskStateTracker for tracking task state
        taskExecutor - a TaskExecutor for executing the Task and its Forks
        countDownLatch - an optional CountDownLatch used to signal the task completion

                      throws InterruptedException

        Block until the task finishes shutting down. This method is guaranteed to only be called after TaskIFace.shutdown() is called.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit this task by doing the following things: 1. Committing each fork by Fork.commit(). 2. Update final state of construct in taskState. 3. Check whether to publish data in task.
